title: Calculating the Unemployment Rate from Labor Force Categories
original_question: The table describes hypothetical employment statistics in a given year. The labour force is the sum of those that are employed plus the unemployed. Labour force: 165 million. Full-time workers and voluntary part-workers: 140 million. Underemployed workers: 7 million. Marginally attached workers: 5 million. Based on the information, what is the unemployment rate? Specify your answer to one decimal place.

segments.text: The table describes hypothetical employment statistics in a given year.
The labour force is the sum of those that are employed plus the unemployed.
segments.highlight_text: labour force is the sum of those that are employed plus the unemployed
segments.explanation: This defines the relationship between the three main categories of the working population.
The denominator for calculating the unemployment rate.

segments.text: Full-time workers and voluntary part-workers: 140 million. Underemployed workers: 7 million.
segments.highlight_text: Full-time workers and voluntary part-workers: 140 million. Underemployed workers: 7 million.
segments.explanation: Underemployed workers are counted as fully employed in the official (U-3) unemployment rate.
Marginally attached workers are NOT part of the labor force and should not be included in the calculation of the standard unemployment rate.

segments.text: Based on the information, what is the unemployment rate? Specify your answer to one decimal place.
segments.explanation: The goal is to find the ratio of unemployed persons to the labor force.

traps.title: The Marginally Attached Distractor
traps.description: Students often mistakenly add marginally attached workers to the unemployed count or the labor force. However, they are officially outside the labor force.

traps.title: Underemployment Misclassification
traps.description: Underemployed workers (those working part-time but wanting full-time) are still counted as 'Employed'. Do not group them with the 'Unemployed'.

solution.step_desc: Identify the total number of employed persons.
solution.content: Employed = Full-time and Voluntary Part-time + Underemployed = 140 million + 7 million = 147 million.

solution.step_desc: Calculate the number of unemployed persons using the labor force formula.
solution.content: Unemployed = Labor Force - Employed = 165 million - 147 million = 18 million.

solution.step_desc: Determine the final result rounded to one decimal place.
solution.content: The result is approximately 10.909...%, which rounds to 10.9%.

title: Calculating Unemployment and Participation Rates
original_question: The country of Otter Island reports employment statistics shown in the table. Use these numbers to calculate the unemployment rate and the labour force participation rate. Working-age population: 300,000. Labour force: 175,000. Employed: 140,000. Enter your calculations as percentages rounded to two decimal places.

segments.text: The country of Otter Island reports employment statistics shown in the table.
Use these numbers to calculate the unemployment rate and the labour force participation rate.
segments.highlight_text: unemployment rate and the labour force participation rate
segments.explanation: The objective is to calculate two distinct statistical ratios based on the provided population data.
This represents the denominator used to calculate the labor force participation rate.
The total number of people either working or actively seeking work. This is the denominator for the unemployment rate and the numerator for the participation rate.
The number of individuals currently holding jobs.

segments.text: Enter your calculations as percentages rounded to two decimal places.
segments.explanation: The final answers must be converted to percentages and rounded to the hundredths place.

traps.title: Denominator Confusion
traps.description: A common error is using the 'Working-age population' as the denominator for the unemployment rate. The unemployment rate is always calculated as a percentage of the 'Labor Force' only.

traps.title: Implicit Variable Omission
traps.description: The number of unemployed people is not explicitly given. Students must derive it from the Labor Force and Employed figures before proceeding to the rate calculation.
